author: chaz
content: Bullish: Let's cut to the chase - NVDA has a market value of $ 3.7 trillion - what's to prevent the price from at least tripling (up 200%) again in 2025 given their backlog, technological know-how, and great margins?  Nothing.  It

author: VinAgain
content: Bullish: NVDA made up stories are having less and less impact.  Competition, Blackwell delays, heating issues….  Endless and Baseless stories but  keeping the multiples in super deal range.   The tricks are running out of steam.

author: JB
content: Even with great results, there’s likely a major sell off afterwards. Not because of NVDA but the Biden economy is in pretty bad shape with 2025 likely to have a recession. We’re forward looking

author: Jamey
content: Bullish: Several days ago I was thinking we’d sell off at ER.  But after today’s FOMO price action with most bad news being rebuffed/resolved, feel we have a better than 50% chance at moving north instead.  So I’m holding.  If wrong…my buy point is low $130‘s.

author: mac
content: Bullish: BEST earning company in the market!

author: Mustafa
content: NVDA is the Biggest Bubble in history. That Ponzi Scheme's market value is now greater than the total GDP of France and Germany. The same Garbage NVDA had $30 billion market value just in 2013-2014. Current Maximum fair value of NVDA Bubble is around $150-200 Billion.

author: D
content: Funny to see how when the stock drops by a few points, bears and shorts are all over the board saying it will crash, and when it goes up, they are mostly silent and the board is inundated by enthusiastic messages by optimistic bulls and longs. Every time.

author: Wah
content: Bearish: jensen huang the CEO of nvda sold 6 million shares over the last few months. he know something we dont know.

author: Christopher
content: I sold. I’ve seen great stocks dip at the open. Big money moves the market. Now, yes it will come back up, but don’t think it can’t or won’t pull back before or after a rally. People will take profits either way. Before or after. Make no mistake.
